required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Quetiapine XR Monotherapy and Augmentation With Lithium Augmentation in TRD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, 6-week, Multicentre, Open-label, Rater-blinded Parallel Group Study Comparing Quetiapine Extended Release Monotherapy and Augmentation With Lithium Augmentation in Patients With Treatment Resistant Depression

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the efficacy of Quetiapine extended release (XR) in combination with an selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) or Venlafaxine versus Lithium in combination with an selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor or Venlafaxine versus Quetiapine extended release monotherapy in subjects with treatment resistant depression as assessed by the changes from randomisation to week 6 in the Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) total score. As an independent objective, the primary objective will also be evaluated in two subgroups of patients: (1) patients who were resistant to two previous antidepressant therapies and (2) in the subgroup of patients with one previous failure.

detailed_description.textblock: The secondary objectives of the study are to compare the effects of the three different treatment regimen as assessed by the following variables and, if applicable, by their changes from randomisation to week 6 (end of study). Additionally the time of onset of therapeutic effect will be assessed by evaluating efficacy data after the first four days (Day 4) of treatment as well as after the first week of treatment (Day 8). These analyses will also be performed in the subgroups of patients with 2 failed previous antidepressants and patients with 1 failure.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Depressive Symptoms Between Randomisation and Week 6 Measured by Change in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score (Per Protocol Analysis Set)
primary_outcome.description: Change in LS mean total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score from randomisation to end-of-treatment (week 6) (Scale 0-60), lower score indicates a better health status.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Depressive Symptoms Between Randomisation and Week 6 Measured by Change in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score (Modified Intention to Treat Analysis Set)
primary_outcome.description: Change in LS mean total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score from randomisation to end-of-treatment (week 6) (Scale 0-60), lower score indicates a better health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale MADRS ≤10, All Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in remission, with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤10. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) ≤10, Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in remission with one previous treatment failure and with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤10. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) ≤10, Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in remission with two previous treatment failure and with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤10. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) ≤8
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in remission with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤8. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) ≤12
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in remission with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤12. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response Rate; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Score Reduced ≥ 50%, All Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Response rate at end of study measured as number of patients with Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) with total score reduction ≥ 50% compared to baseline, the higher number of patients the better

secondary_outcome.measure: Response Rate; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Score Reduced ≥ 50%, Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Response rate at end of study measured as number of patients with Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) with total score reduction ≥ 50% compared to baseline, the higher number of patients the better

secondary_outcome.measure: Response Rate; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Score Reduced ≥ 50%, Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Response rate at end of study measured as number of patients with Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) with total score reduction ≥ 50% compared to baseline, the higher number of patients the better

secondary_outcome.measure: Responder: Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I) Item 2, All Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Change in global improvement measured by Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I). Scale from 1-4, where lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Responder: Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI)-I Item 2, Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in global improvement measured by Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I). Scale from 1-4, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Responder: Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I) Item 2, Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in global improvement measured by Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I). Scale from 1-4, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S), All Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Change in severity of illness measured by Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S). Scale form 1-7, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S), Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in severity of illness measured by Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S). Scale from 1-7, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S), Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in severity of illness measured by Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S). Scale from 1-7, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Beck Depression Inventory (BDI)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rating assessment of depressive symptoms using Beck Depression Inventory (BDI). Scale from 0-63, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain, Measured by Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rating assessment of pain using a visual analogue scale (VAS). Scale from 0-100, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Anxiety Measured by Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rating assessment of anxiety using a visual analogue scale (VAS). Scale from 0-100, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Anxiety Measured by State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), State Anxiety Inventory
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rating assessment of anxiety measured by STAI, state anxiety inventory (Scale 20-80, where a lower value shows a larger improvement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Anxiety Measured by STAI, Trait Anxiety Inventory
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rating assessment of anxiety measured by State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), trait anxiety inventory (Scale 20-80, where a lower value shows a larger improvement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep Quality Measured by Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS), Item 4
secondary_outcome.description: Sleeping quality measured by Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) item 4 (reduced sleep) (Scale 0-6, where a lower value shows a larger improvement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep Quality Measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rated sleeping quality measured by PSQI (Scale 0-21, subscales 0-3, 18 questions, where a lower value shows a larger improvement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life Measured by Short-form Health Survey (SF-36), Mental Component
secondary_outcome.description: Self rating assessment of quality in life using SF-36, mental component (Scale 0-100, where a higher value shows a larger improvement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life Measured by Short-form Health Survey (SF-36), Physical Component
secondary_outcome.description: Self rating assessment of quality in life using SF-36, physical component (Scale 0-100, where a higher value shows a larger improvement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life Measured by Health Questionnaire EQ-5D as Utility
secondary_outcome.description: Self rating assessment of quality in life using EQ-5D utility (Scale 0-100, where a higher value shows a larger improvement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment: General Health (WPAI:GH)
secondary_outcome.description: Self rating assessment of working productivity using WPAI:GH (Scale 0 to number of hours worked during a week multiplied with the salary in Euro, a lower value shows a larger improvement)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Item 4 Efficacy and Safety Combined, All Patients
secondary_outcome.description: The physician has evaluated the therapeutic effect and the side effect combined at end of study. Patients with a 'marked/moderate' therapeutic effect and 'None/Do Not Significantly Interfere' side effect has been added. The higher values show more patients with a treatment effect without any side-effect. The range is from 0 patients to the maximum number of patients in the treatment arm (225, 229 or 221).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Item 4 Efficacy and Safety Combined, Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: The physician has evaluated the therapeutic effect and the side effect combined at end of study. Patients with a 'marked/moderate' therapeutic effect and 'None/Do Not Significantly Interfere' side effect has been added. The higher values show more patients with a treatment effect without any side-effect. The range is from 0 patients to the maximum number of patients in the treatment arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Item 4 Efficacy and Safety Combined, Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failures
secondary_outcome.description: The physician has evaluated the therapeutic effect and the side effect combined at end of study. Patients with a 'marked/moderate' therapeutic effect and 'None/Do Not Significantly Interfere' side effect has been added. The higher values show more patients with a treatment effect without any side-effect. The range is from 0 patients to the maximum number of patients in the treatment arm.

arm_group.description: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRI) or Venlafaxine from previous therapy + add-on treatment with quetiapine XR, 300mg tablet once daily (od). From previous anti-depressant treatment 64% of the patients had SSRI and 35% had Venlafaxine at baseline.

Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRI) or venlafaxine from previous therapy + add-on treatment with lithium, approximately 900mg tablet once daily (od). From previous anti-depressant treatment 67% of the patients had SSRI and 33% had Venlafaxine at baseline.
Switch from previous treatment with SSRI or venlafaxine to quetiapine XR monotherapy, 300mg tablet once daily (od)

intervention.description: SSRI - doses within label, Venlafaxine dose up to 225 mg/day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documented clinical diagnosis as confirmed by the M.I.N.I. meeting criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental disorders, 4th Edition (DSM-IV) for any of the following:296.2x MDD, Single Episode296.3x MDD, Recurrent Episode
- Current episode of depression present, at least 42 days prior to enrolment but not more than 18 months
- MADRS-Score ≥ 25 at enrolment and randomisation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a DSM-IV Axis I disorder other than MDD within 6 months of randomisation
- Patients with a diagnosis of DSM-IV Axis II disorder which has a major impact on the patient's current psychiatric status
- Patients who, in the investigator's judgment pose a current serious suicidal or homicidal risk, or have made a suicide attempt within the past 6 months

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a 3 arm, open-label randomised, rater blinded, parallel group study comparing quetiapine XR monotherapy and augmentation with lithium augmentation in patients with treatment resistant depression, Recruitment period 6 November 2008 to 19 June 2009
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: At visit 1 and 2 (randomisation) the patients should have a Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) total score above or equal to 25

group.description: Switch from previous treatment with SSRI or venlafaxine to quetiapine XR monotherapy, 300mg tablet once daily (od)

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Baseline characteristics are presented using the ITT population (Quetiapine XR mono 225 participants, Add-on Quetiapine XR 229 participants and Add-on Lithium 221 participants) and not all randomized patients

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Baseline characteristics are presented using the ITT population (Quetiapine XR mono 225 participants, Add-on Quetiapine XR 229 participants and Add-on Lithium 221 participants) and not all randomized patients

measure.title: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-IV)
Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) total score
measure.description: Units on a scale from 0 to 60. Lower score indicates a better health status.

measure.title: Weight

outcome.title: Change in Depressive Symptoms Between Randomisation and Week 6 Measured by Change in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score (Per Protocol Analysis Set)
outcome.description: Change in LS mean total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score from randomisation to end-of-treatment (week 6) (Scale 0-60), lower score indicates a better health status.
outcome.population: Analysis was 'per protocol'. Exclusion reason from analysis: Violation of exclusion/inclusion criteria; Non-compliance regarding prohibited concomitant medication, Total unavailability of MADRS score after randomization, Patient not treated with any dose of study drug after randomization, Non-compliance regarding titration to 300 mg quetiapine/d.

group.title: Quetiapine XR Mono
group.description: Switch from previous treatment with SSRI or venlafaxine to quetiapine XR monotherapy, 300mg tablet once daily (od)

group.title: Add-on Quetiapine XR
group.description: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRI) or venlafaxine from previous therapy + add-on treatment with quetiapine XR, 300mg tablet once daily (od)

group.title: Add-on Lithium
group.description: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRI) or venlafaxine from previous therapy + add-on treatment with lithium, approximately 900mg tablet once daily (od)

measure.title: Change in Depressive Symptoms Between Randomisation and Week 6 Measured by Change in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score (Per Protocol Analysis Set)
measure.description: Change in LS mean total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score from randomisation to end-of-treatment (week 6) (Scale 0-60), lower score indicates a better health status.
measure.population: Analysis was 'per protocol'. Exclusion reason from analysis: Violation of exclusion/inclusion criteria; Non-compliance regarding prohibited concomitant medication, Total unavailability of MADRS score after randomization, Patient not treated with any dose of study drug after randomization, Non-compliance regarding titration to 300 mg quetiapine/d.

analysis.groups_desc: Add-on quetiapine XR was tested versus add-on lithium for non-inferiority. The null hypothesis was that the add-on quetiapine treatment was non-inferior to add-on lithium.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin for differences was set to 3 units in the MADRS total score. A power set to 80% and using a Bonferroni-adjusted one-sided alpha* = alpha/3 = 0.0083 yields a planned sample size of 192 patients per study group. With a drop out of 4% a total of 600 randomized patients were required to obtain 192 efficacy evaluable patients per treatment group.

analysis.groups_desc: Quetiapine XR mono was tested versus add-on lithium for non-inferiority. The null hypothesis was that the quetiapine XR mono treatment was non-inferior to add-on lithium.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin for differences was set to 3 units in the MADRS total score. A power set to 80% and using a Bonferroni-adjusted one-sided alpha* = alpha/3 = 0.0083 yields a planned sample size of 192 patients per study group. With a drop out of 4% a total of 600 randomized patients were required to obtain 192 efficacy evaluable patients per treatment group.

outcome.title: Change in Depressive Symptoms Between Randomisation and Week 6 Measured by Change in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score (Modified Intention to Treat Analysis Set)
outcome.description: Change in LS mean total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score from randomisation to end-of-treatment (week 6) (Scale 0-60), lower score indicates a better health status.

group.title: Quetiapine XR Mono
group.description: Switch from previous treatment with SSRI or venlafaxine to quetiapine XR monotherapy, 300mg tablet once daily (od)

group.title: Add-on Quetiapine XR

measure.title: Change in Depressive Symptoms Between Randomisation and Week 6 Measured by Change in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score (Modified Intention to Treat Analysis Set)
measure.description: Change in LS mean total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score from randomisation to end-of-treatment (week 6) (Scale 0-60), lower score indicates a better health status.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis was that the add-on quetiapine XR treatment was not different to the add-on lithium treatment. The power calculation was done for the primary non-inferior analysis. This superiority analysis was only done if the non-inferior analysis was successful.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjustment for multiplicity was done, alpha = 0.025
analysis.method_desc: Superiority testing of primary outcome showed no significant difference in the Modified Intention To Treat (ITT) population

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis was that the quetiapine XR mono treatment was not different from the add-on lithium treatment. The power calculation was done for the primary non-inferior analysis. This superiority analysis was only done if the non-inferior analysis was successful.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjustment for multiplicity was done, alpha = 0.025
analysis.method_desc: Superiority testing of primary outcome showed no significant difference in the Modified Intention To Treat (ITT) population

outcome.title: Change in Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Item 4 Efficacy and Safety Combined, All Patients
outcome.description: The physician has evaluated the therapeutic effect and the side effect combined at end of study. Patients with a ‘marked/moderate’ therapeutic effect and ‘None/Do Not Significantly Interfere’ side effect has been added. The higher values show more patients with a treatment effect without any side-effect. The range is from 0 patients to the maximum number of patients in the treatment arm (225, 229 or 221).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
